title: MMA star Mei Yamaguchi fights for memory of her mother
text:
(CNN) Mei Yamaguchi has been fighting all her life. Born in Tokyo, Japan, she was whisked away as a five-year-old with her mother to Los Angeles, where she developed a love for the movies of Jackie Chan and helped foster an early desire to replicate her martial arts hero.

But life wasn't easy. Yamaguchi was bullied at school because of the way she looked and talked. Then at the age of nine her mother died and she moved back to Japan to be with her father.

Such a start in life would prove derailing for many, but Yamaguchi found solace in her karate.

Mei Yamaguchi (L) fights Angela Lee of Singapore during One Championship: Ascent to Power at Singapore Indoor Stadium in 2016.

"It gave me confidence," Yamaguchi told CNN Sport's Alex Thomas. "I was training my inner mentality. That helped me to stay strong."
